page.title: 07Schools
page.content: The Church of England Primary School is a small two class village school with 28 pupils.Children commence in the term they attain the age of five. When they are eight they moove up to the second class and at eleven they transfer to Comprehensive school.With a teaching staff of 2.2 it's difficult to cover all areas of the curriculum adequately so once a week the Infant teacher,Mrs.White,exchanges with a music teacher from another school and mothers come to take cookery.As the school has no sportsfield Mr.Smith,the headmaster, and the Junior children travel to another school to share its facilities and travel to Neston for swimming lessons once a week.Pupils transfer to Whitby Comprehensive and as there is no public transport a special bus takes and collects them each day.
